intro: Sideroxylon adolfi-friederici, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a member of the Burseraceae family. It is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa, characterized by its hard, dense wood that is highly valued for its durability. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by spherical, woody fruits. Its bark is thick and fissured, often exuding a resinous sap that has been used traditionally for various purposes. The species is adapted to dry climates and plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
